definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
to take/to borrow/to pick (flowers, fruit etc)/to pluck/to select/to remove/to take off (glasses, hat etc)

sentences.english: Reader's Digest is the most influential magazine in Canadian publishing history.
sentences.chinese: 《讀者文摘》是加拿大發行史上最有影響力的雜誌。

sentences.english: He now even has the tremendous circulation of the Reader's Digest behind him.
sentences.chinese: 現在他的《讀者文摘》已經有了一個巨大的讀者羣。

sentences.english: I'm reading Reader's Digest in the kitchen. I am totally nonplussed.
sentences.chinese: 我在廚房裏看讀者文摘，完全不以爲然。

sentences.english: The magazine she gave me is Reader's Digest.
sentences.chinese: 她給我的雜誌是《讀者文摘》。

sentences.english: The world smiles with Reader's digest.
sentences.chinese: 讀者文摘給世界理家來歡笑。

definition: Jobs (name)/see also 史提夫·賈伯斯|史提夫·贾伯斯[Shi3 ti2 fu1 · Jia3 bo2 si1], Steve Jobs
a tax declaration form/a tax return
the name of various newspapers, notably Le Monde (France), El Mundo (Spain) and Die Welt (Germany)
to play the same old tune (idiom); unoriginal
literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
The New Yorker, US magazine/resident of New York
South China Morning Post (newspaper in Hong Kong)
